Defines the complete prominence scale configuration including ordered labels, probability distribution across tiers, threshold boundaries, and numeric min/max range
Provides optional overrides for constructing a ProminenceScale, allowing customization of labels, distribution weights, and numeric range from defaults
Enumerates the narrative nature of a relationship or status (positive, neutral, negative) used to derive semantic meaning for alliance/rivalry and triumph/downfall detection
Defines a relationship kind including its source/destination entity kind constraints, directionality, polarity, and framework-protected status for world graph edge typing
Enumerates the five prominence tiers (forgotten, marginal, recognized, renowned, mythic) representing an entity's notoriety level in the world
Represents a 3D position (x, y, z) in semantic space used for entity placement within semantic planes and spatial queries
Aliases WorldEntity as the type for initial world state entities, establishing that seed data uses the same canonical shape as simulation output
Aliases WorldRelationship as the type for initial world state relationships, establishing that seed data uses the same canonical shape as simulation output
Defines a visual rendering style for image generation, including its prompt fragment, keywords, and medium category for injecting artistic direction into generated images
Enumerates visual medium categories (painting, ink-print, digital, camera, experimental, document) used to group and filter artistic styles for image generation
Defines a visual framing and arrangement style for image generation, including its prompt fragment and target entity category for context-appropriate composition suggestions
Extends EntityCategory with composition-specific groupings (pair, pose, landscape) to classify what framing arrangements a composition style is suited for
Defines a rule that prevents specific artistic style and composition style pairings from random selection, with category-based matching and explicit allow-list overrides
Defines a color palette for image generation using soft hierarchy language (dominated by, supported by, accents) to guide color distribution in generated images
Defines a narrative casting role (e.g., protagonist, schemer) with cardinality constraints and entity-kind/category filters for selecting which entities fill narrative roles in chronicles
Specifies target ranges for total word count and scene count, constraining the length and structural division of generated narrative content
Distinguishes between the two chronicle output formats: 'story' for prose narratives and 'document' for in-universe document formats
Defines a prose narrative style for chronicle generation with freeform instruction blocks for structure, prose, and events, plus structured role definitions and pacing constraints

Classifies how a narrative style contributes to era-level prompt assembly: 'structural' for major era-defining events, 'contextual' for institutional/cultural background, or 'flavor' for atmospheric color
Defines an in-universe document format narrative style with freeform text blocks for document/event instructions, role definitions, and pacing constraints for chronicle generation
Union type combining StoryNarrativeStyle and DocumentNarrativeStyle into a single discriminated union keyed on the format field for polymorphic narrative style handling
Aggregates all available style resources (artistic styles, composition styles, color palettes, narrative styles) into a single collection for style selection and browsing
Records the user's chosen artistic style, composition style, and color palette IDs for image generation, supporting explicit selection, random, or culture-default modes
Defines a rule that prevents specific artistic style and composition style pairings from random selection, with category-based matching and explicit allow-list overrides
Provides optional UI display hints for domain visualization including a world icon emoji, ordered prominence level names, and per-level color mappings
Enumerates the five prominence tiers (forgotten, marginal, recognized, renowned, mythic) representing an entity's notoriety level in the world
Represents a 3D position (x, y, z) in semantic space used for entity placement within semantic planes and spatial queries
Defines the key-value tag storage on entities where values are either strings or booleans, used for semantic tagging and conditional logic in templates and systems
Enumerates the origin types of world mutations (template, system, action, seed, engine, creation_batch) for lineage tracking, deduplication, and causal debugging
Records the full context of a world mutation including tick, source type, source identifier, success flag, and narration text for lineage tracking and debugging
Defines the complete state of an entity in the world graph including identity, kind, status, prominence, culture, tags, coordinates, temporal bounds, and creation lineage
Defines a directed relationship between two entities in the world graph including kind, strength, distance, lifecycle status, and creation lineage metadata

Enumerates domain-agnostic narrative event types detectable from framework primitives and polarity metadata, covering state changes, relationship events, entity lifecycle, and template/system executions
Provides a lightweight entity reference (id, name, kind, subtype) for use within narrative event records without carrying full entity state
Enumerates the types of individual changes that can happen to an entity: creation, ending, relationship formation/dissolution, tag gain/loss, and field value changes
Enumerates narrative interpretations of raw mutation effects using polarity metadata, classifying changes as betrayal, reconciliation, alliance, rivalry, triumph, or downfall
Records a single granular change to an entity during a narrative event, including the effect type and relevant details (relationship kind, tag, field change, semantic interpretation)
Groups all effects that happened to a single entity during a narrative event, pairing the entity reference with its list of individual effects
Records a semantically meaningful world change for narrative generation, including event kind, significance score, tick, era, summary, participant effects, and causal lineage
Stores emergent regions that formed during simulation, keyed by entity kind, separate from seed regions defined in the schema
Records the outcome of a single validation check including its name, pass/fail status, failure count, and descriptive details
Aggregates all validation check results with summary counts of total checks, passes, and failures for post-simulation quality assessment
Tracks graph connectivity metrics including the number of connected components and the tick at which the world graph first became fully connected
Records simulation run metadata including run ID, current tick/epoch/era, duration, completion status, entity/relationship counts, enrichment status, and meta-entity formation statistics
Defines the complete simulation output including schema snapshot, metadata, entity and relationship arrays, pressure levels, narrative history, coordinate state, and validation results

Represents the context for a chronicle lore backport session, including the chronicle text, its entity participants with role flags, the perspective synthesis data, and per-entity backport status tracking
Summarizes an entity targeted for bulk backport, capturing its identity (ID, name, kind, subtype) and the number of chronicles that will contribute lore updates to it
Tracks the progress of a single chronicle within a bulk backport operation, including entity processing counts, batch completion, and per-chronicle status/error state

Represents the overall state machine for bulk backport operations across multiple chronicles, tracking workflow status, per-chronicle progress, cumulative entity counts, cost, and an entity summary for user confirmation
Defines the public API returned by the useBulkBackport hook, exposing the current progress state, active status flag, and functions to prepare, confirm, or cancel a bulk backport session
Enumerates the three operations available in bulk historian mode: review (annotate), edition (revise descriptions), and clear (remove historian content)
Summarizes an entity selected for bulk historian processing, including its identity, assigned tone, and estimated output token count based on current description length
Represents the full state of a bulk historian operation, tracking workflow phase, entity progress, current processing target, cost accumulation, and failed entity details
Defines the public API returned by the useBulkHistorian hook, exposing progress state, active flag, and functions to prepare, confirm, cancel, and adjust tone for bulk historian operations

Represents the metadata for a chronicle including its format (story/document), generation sampling mode, role assignments mapping entities to narrative roles, and optional narrative lens configuration

Configuration for initiating a chronicle lore backport session, specifying the project/simulation context, the source chronicle ID and text, and the perspective synthesis output to guide entity description updates

Defines the public API returned by the useChronicleLoreBackport hook, exposing the current revision run state, active status, chronicle ID, and functions to start, toggle patch decisions, and apply accepted changes
Configuration for starting a world dynamics generation session, providing project context, static pages content, schema context, in-memory entity and relationship data for context assembly

Defines the public API returned by the useDynamicsGeneration hook, exposing the current run state, active flag, and functions to start generation, submit user feedback, accept proposed dynamics, or cancel the session

Represents an entity with its full set of enrichment-relevant fields including identity, description, summary, narrative hint, tags, and the optional EntityEnrichment metadata for visual and text enrichments
Aggregates enrichment queue statistics by counting items in each status category (queued, running, completed, errored) plus the total count

Defines the public API returned by the useEnrichmentQueue hook, exposing queue state, worker readiness, stats, and functions to initialize, enqueue, cancel, retry, clear, and apply enrichment results to entities
Configuration for starting an era narrative generation session, specifying the era identity, tone, optional arc direction override, historian persona config, and pre-computed chronicle prep briefs

Defines the public API returned by the useEraNarrative hook, exposing the narrative record state, active flag, and functions for interactive start, headless start, resumption from IndexedDB, and step progression
Lightweight summary of a chronicle targeted for fact coverage analysis, containing only its ID and title for display in confirmation dialogs
Tracks the progress of a batch fact coverage analysis across multiple chronicles, including workflow status, processing counts, cost accumulation, and per-chronicle failure details
Defines the public API returned by the useFactCoverage hook, exposing progress state, active flag, and functions to prepare, confirm, cancel, and close fact coverage analysis sessions
Represents a preview of a historian edition operation showing the edition config, target entity name, original description history count, and the compressed history entries that will be used
Configuration for starting a historian chronology session, specifying the era identity, serialized context (era info, chronicle data, previous eras), historian persona config, and tone setting

Defines the public API returned by the useHistorianChronology hook, exposing the run state, active flag, and functions to start a chronology session, adjust individual year assignments, and apply all assignments
Configuration for starting a historian edition session to revise an entity's description, including the entity's full identity, current description and summary, and description history for context
Defines the public API returned by the useHistorianEdition hook, exposing the revision run state, active flag, and functions to start the edition, toggle patch acceptance, and apply accepted changes

Configuration for starting a historian review (annotation) session, specifying the target type and identity, source text, serialized metadata context, and sample historian outputs for few-shot prompting
Defines the public API returned by the useHistorianReview hook, exposing the run state, active flag, and functions to start review, toggle note decisions, apply accepted notes, and cancel
Represents the user's image generation preferences including selected artistic style, composition style, color palette, image size, quality level, culture filter, and UI section collapse states
Function type that accepts a partial ImageGenSettings object and merges it into the current settings state

Defines the public API returned by the useStyleLibrary hook, exposing the loaded style library, loading state, custom/default indicator, and CRUD functions for managing artistic styles, composition styles, color palettes, and narrative styles
Configuration for starting a batch summary revision session, providing world dynamics context, static pages content, schema context, and user-editable revision guidance for prompt tuning

Defines the public API returned by the useSummaryRevision hook, exposing the revision run state, active flag, and functions to start revision, continue batches, auto-continue all, and toggle patch acceptance
Lightweight summary of a chronicle targeted for tone ranking, containing only its ID and title for confirmation display
Tracks the progress of LLM-based tone ranking across multiple chronicles, including workflow status, processing counts, cost accumulation, and per-chronicle failure details

Represents a single chronicle's tone ranking result with the LLM's ranked top-3 tones, the assigned tone after corpus balancing, and whether the assignment was shifted from the top choice for diversity
Aggregates all tone assignment entries with a distribution histogram showing how many chronicles were assigned to each tone, for user review before applying

Defines the public API returned by the useToneRanking hook, exposing two-phase controls: phase 1 for LLM ranking (prepare, confirm, cancel) and phase 2 for corpus-balanced assignment (preview and apply)
Defines optional callback functions for receiving streaming thinking and text deltas during browser-based LLM task execution, keyed by task ID

Represents the user's selections from the chronicle wizard including role assignments defining the cast, optional narrative lens, selected event and relationship IDs, and the entry point entity for graph traversal
Result of checking whether entities selected for chronicle generation have the required descriptions, listing any missing prerequisites that should be generated first

Defines the complete data structure for exporting a chronicle, including version metadata, chronicle identity, all generation versions, plan data, perspective synthesis, image references, historian notes, and temporal context
Represents a single version snapshot within an era narrative export, capturing the content text, word count, generation step type (generate/edit), timestamp, LLM call details, token usage, and cost
Defines the complete data structure for exporting an era narrative, including narrative metadata, thread synthesis (thesis, quotes, strategic dynamics), content versions, and image references
Distinguishes the two chronicle output formats: story (narrative prose) and document (in-world artifact like a letter, decree, or report)
Controls the LLM sampling temperature for chronicle generation: normal for standard output or low for more deterministic, focused generation
Maps an entity to its narrative role within a chronicle, specifying the role identifier (e.g., protagonist, scribe) and a description of how the entity functions in the narrative

Defines the narrative focus configuration for a chronicle plan, including focus mode, entry point, primary/supporting/selected entity IDs, selected events, and optional notes

Defines the structural outline for document-format chronicles, including purpose, key points, era, tone, and optional fields for veracity, legitimacy, audience, author provenance, bias, and intended outcome
Defines the structural outline for story-format chronicles, including purpose, key points, era, tone, theme, emotional beats, and optional fields for stakes, transformation, and intended impact
Represents a single beat in a chronicle's plot structure, consisting of a description and the narrative event IDs that drive this beat
Defines the plot structure for a chronicle, including the plot type from the narrative style, the raw LLM-generated structure, and normalized beats extracted for section expansion

Represents a section within a chronicle's generation plan, defining its name, purpose, goal, involved entities and events, word count target, and format-specific fields for story (emotional arc, setting) or document (content guidance) modes
Represents the complete generation plan for a chronicle including title, format, entity roles, narrative focus, plot structure or document outline, and the section breakdown
Represents a single pass/fail cohesion check result with explanatory notes, used as a building block within the broader cohesion report
Extends the basic cohesion check with a section ID reference, allowing validation of whether a specific chronicle section achieved its stated goal
Describes a specific cohesion issue found during chronicle validation, with severity level, optional section reference, check type classification, description, and suggested fix

Comprehensive validation report for a generated chronicle, including an overall score, structured checks (plot, entity consistency, section goals, resolution, factual accuracy, theme), and a list of specific issues
Enumerates all lifecycle states of a chronicle from creation through generation, assembly review, editing, validation, to completion or failure
Maps an entity to a role defined in the narrative style's entity rules (e.g., protagonist, witness), carrying the role ID, entity identity fields, and a primary flag indicating narrative centrality
Represents an optional contextual frame entity assigned in the chronicle wizard that shapes the narrative perspective without being a cast member, typically a rule, occurrence, or ability

Provides the full context for an entity within chronicle generation, including identity fields, tags, era association, summary, description, aliases, and optional enrichment data like visual thesis and neighbor summaries
Represents a relationship between two entities with resolved names and kinds for both source and target, plus optional strength and enriched backstory from Layer 2 processing
Minimal era context carrying only the era's ID, name, and optional description, used as a lightweight reference in chronicle generation
Provides the full context for a narrative event within chronicle generation, including tick, era, event kind, significance, headline, subject/object entities, participant list, and state changes
Defines a per-era text override for a world dynamic statement, allowing era-specific phrasing of macro-level forces and tensions
Represents a macro-level world dynamic statement describing inter-culture conflicts or entity-kind behaviors, with optional culture/kind relevance filters and per-era text overrides
Distinguishes between single-entity and ensemble chronicle focus types in the chronicle-first architecture

Defines the complete focus configuration for a chronicle including focus type, role assignments as primary identity, optional narrative lens, derived primary/supporting entity ID lists, and entry point

Distinguishes between world_truth facts (in-universe knowledge that gets faceted through perspective synthesis) and generation_constraint facts (meta-instructions to correct LLM tendencies, always included verbatim)
Represents a canon fact for perspective synthesis with its text content, type classification (world_truth or generation_constraint), required flag for mandatory inclusion, and optional exclusion flag
Controls how many world-truth facts are selected for perspective synthesis faceting, with minimum and maximum count bounds
Holds the composable tone guidance for chronicle generation, containing the core prose style direction

Stores the persisted result of perspective synthesis including the generated brief, fact facets with interpretations, suggested motifs, narrative voice blending, entity directives, and LLM usage metadata

Provides the complete context for chronicle prompt building, including world name/description, assembled tone (post-synthesis), canon facts, and the raw inputs for perspective synthesis (facts with metadata, tone fragments, cultural identities)

Enumerates display size hints for images placed within chronicle text: small, medium, large, or full-width

Container for all image references within a chronicle, holding the refs array along with generation timestamp and model identifier

Complete compatibility analysis comparing existing image refs against new chronicle content after regeneration, aggregating per-ref results with overall reusable/needs-regeneration/needs-review counts
Captures the user's decision for how to handle a specific image ref during chronicle regeneration: reuse the existing image, regenerate it, or skip it entirely
Represents the cover montage image for a chronicle, including the LLM-generated scene description, involved entity IDs for visual compositing, and generation status tracking
Classifies the temporal scale of a chronicle based on its tick range: moment (1-5 ticks), episode (5-20), arc (20-50), or saga (50+ or multi-era)

Classifies how strongly a canon fact appears in chronicle text: missing, mentioned (briefly referenced), prevalent (meaningfully present), or integral (deeply woven into the narrative)

Represents the coverage analysis of a single canon fact within a chronicle, including the fact text, coverage rating, evidence quote, and whether the fact was in the faceted set from perspective synthesis
Aggregates fact coverage analysis results for a chronicle, listing all fact entries with LLM model used and token usage/cost metadata
Records an entity mentioned in chronicle text that was not part of the declared primary or secondary cast, tracking the matched text span and user acceptance status
Tracks whether an entity's description has been backported from a chronicle, recording the entity ID, backport status (completed or not needed), and timestamp

The primary persisted data structure for a chronicle in IndexedDB, containing all identity fields, generation versions, plan, perspective synthesis, image references, historian notes, temporal context, status, and cost metadata
Enumerates the pipeline steps that can produce a chronicle version: initial generate, regenerate, creative freedom, combine (merge versions), or copy edit

Stored snapshot of a chronicle generation version capturing the content text, word count, model, sampling mode, prompts sent to the LLM, optional cost breakdown, and the pipeline step that produced it

Metadata used to create a chronicle shell record before generation begins, providing project context, model, chronicle identity (format, style, role assignments, lens), and selected entity/event/relationship IDs

Extended chronicle creation metadata including all shell fields plus the actual LLM prompts, generation sampling mode, and additional generation-time context like temporal information and fact coverage
Tracks how many chronicles reference a specific entity, maintaining a count and the list of chronicle IDs for cross-referencing
Tracks how many chronicles use a specific narrative style, maintaining a count and the list of chronicle IDs for cross-referencing
Input data for entity constellation analysis, providing the entities, relationships, events, and optional focal era to analyze the composition of a chronicle's cast

Classifies the entity-kind composition of a constellation as focused on characters, places, objects, events, or mixed across multiple kinds
Classifies the spatial distribution of entities in a constellation as either tight (clustered) or dispersed across the coordinate space
Classifies whether the entities in a constellation span a single era or multiple eras

Comprehensive analysis of a chronicle's entity cast, including culture distribution, kind distribution, tag frequencies, relationship kinds, temporal span, event statistics, and derived classifications for culture balance, kind focus, spatial spread, and era span
Defines per-million-token pricing rates for text LLM models, with separate input and output costs

Defines token-based pricing for GPT image models, with per-million-token rates and estimated output token counts per quality level
Union type representing either DALL-E per-image pricing or GPT token-based pricing for image generation models
Metadata stored alongside enrichment results tracking estimated and actual costs, token counts, model used, and generation timestamp
Aggregated cost data combining total estimated and actual costs across text and image tasks, with per-model breakdowns including counts

Enumerates all billable LLM operation categories in Illuminator including description, image, chronicle generation variants, perspective synthesis, historian operations, dynamics, revision, era narratives, and quality checks

Represents a single cost tracking record persisted to IndexedDB, capturing the operation context (project, entity, chronicle), operation type, model, and both estimated and actual costs with token counts
Input type for creating cost records that auto-generates ID and timestamp if not provided, requiring all other CostRecord fields
Aggregated cost summary with totals, record count, and breakdowns by operation type and by model, each carrying estimated/actual costs and counts
Defines a scene prompt template that instructs the scene-description LLM what kind of visual to describe for cover image generation, mapping narrative styles to visual direction
Pairs a scene prompt template ID with a composition style ID to configure cover image generation for a specific narrative style
Represents a single entry in an entity's description history, recording the previous description text, what replaced it (source), and when the replacement occurred

Enumerates the lifecycle states of a dynamics generation run: pending (awaiting first LLM call), running, awaiting feedback, complete, cancelled, or error
Identifies the sender of a message in the multi-turn dynamics generation conversation: system, assistant (LLM), or user
Represents a single message in the dynamics generation conversation with its role, content text, and timestamp
Represents a single world dynamic statement proposed by the LLM, with optional culture and entity-kind relevance filters and per-era text overrides
Structured LLM response from a dynamics generation turn, containing the current set of proposed dynamics, reasoning text shown to the user, and a completion flag
Persisted IndexedDB record for a dynamics generation session, tracking the run identity, status, conversation history, proposed dynamics, user feedback, and LLM cost metadata

Enumerates all supported enrichment task types in Illuminator, from basic description and image generation through chronicle operations, historian workflows, era narratives, and quality analysis tasks

Discriminated union specifying which image to display at a chronicle backref anchor in an entity description: the chronicle's cover image, a specific image ref from the chronicle, or an entity's portrait image

Captures raw network request/response data for debugging LLM API calls, including provider, HTTP status, duration, request ID, and rate limit headers
Collects NetworkDebugInfo for each step in the three-phase description chain: narrative generation, visual thesis extraction, and visual traits derivation
Enumerates the possible states of an entity's enrichment: missing (not started), queued, running, complete, or error
Holds the output of an enrichment task including optional summary, description, aliases, visual thesis, visual traits, image ID, chronicle ID, revised prompt, and cost metadata
Records an enrichment error with its message text and the timestamp when it occurred
Represents a chronicle that has been accepted by the user, containing its identity, content, optional summary, image refs, entity IDs, generation metadata, and acceptance timestamp
Stores enrichment state on an entity, containing text enrichment metadata (visual fields, aliases, costs), image metadata (model, prompt chain, cost), and description chain debug info
Shared payload fields for all enrichment queue items and worker tasks, including task ID, entity identity, simulation run ID, task type, prompt text, and optional image size override
Discriminated union of enrichment task payloads: description and visualThesis tasks carry additional visual thesis/traits instructions, while all other task types use the base payload only
Represents a pending enrichment request in the queue, extending EnrichmentTaskPayload with lifecycle timestamps, status, result, error, debug info, and estimated cost

Enumerates the specific generation or analysis steps available for chronicle enrichment tasks, from initial generation through regeneration variants, comparison, combination, copy editing, image refs, and cover image generation
Extends EnrichmentTaskPayload with project ID and resolved LLM call settings, creating the complete task payload sent to the enrichment worker for execution
Represents the result returned by the enrichment worker after task execution, including task identity, success flag, optional result/error, and debug info
Result of applying an enrichment to an entity, containing the updated EntityEnrichment metadata plus optional summary and description field updates (undefined means no change, null means clear)

Classifies how closely related a name match source is to the entity being renamed: self (the entity itself), related (direct neighbor), cast (chronicle cast member), participant (event participant), mention (text reference), or general
Identifies the type of object containing a name match: entity (description/summary), chronicle (text/metadata), or event (description/effects)

Represents a single occurrence of an entity name found during rename scanning, with source location, field name, match type (full, partial, metadata, id_slug), original text span, and relationship tier
Records the user's decision for a specific rename match: accept the automatic replacement, reject (leave unchanged), or edit (provide custom replacement text)
Complete result of scanning the codebase for occurrences of an entity's old name, collecting all matches across entities, chronicles, and events
Represents a set of field-level changes to apply to a single entity during a rename operation
Represents a set of field-level updates to apply to a single chronicle during a rename operation
Represents a set of field-level changes to apply to a single narrative event during a rename operation
Aggregates all patches produced by a rename operation across entities, chronicles, and events into a single structure for batch application
Minimal entity data needed for rename scanning: identity fields, text content (summary, description, narrative hint), and description history for thorough name occurrence detection
Minimal narrative event data needed for rename scanning, including subject/action, description text, and participant effects with their entity references
Describes a text replacement within a field during rename patch building, specifying the character position, original text length, and replacement string

Enumerates the available tonal presets for long-form era narrative writing, including witty, cantankerous, bemused, defiant, elegiac, sardonic, awestruck, and others tuned for sustained historian voice
Enumerates the three sequential steps of era narrative generation: thread synthesis, narrative text generation, and editorial revision
Enumerates the lifecycle states of an era narrative: pending, generating, step complete (awaiting review), complete, cancelled, or failed

Represents a narrative thread identified during era synthesis, connecting multiple chronicles through shared cultural actors, an arc describing transformation across the era, and optional register and voice constraints
Records an in-world text artifact quotable as primary source material within an era narrative, preserving the verbatim text, artifact origin, and contextual significance
Captures a strategic interaction between cultures or factions inferred by the historian from the broader archive, recording the interaction label, actors involved, and reconstructed dynamic
Plans a single movement (temporal section) within an era narrative, specifying its index, year range, opening world state, focused threads, and key cultural beats
Complete output of thread synthesis for an era, containing identified threads, thesis statement, counterweight (what survived), optional quotes, strategic dynamics, movements, and motifs
Legacy single-object model for era narrative content, storing the generated text, optional edited version, word counts, timestamps, model, prompts, and token/cost metadata
Versioned era narrative content replacing the legacy single-object model, capturing content text, word count, generation step (generate/edit), timestamp, model, prompts, and token/cost metadata
Tracks the cover image for an era narrative including the scene description, generation status (pending/generating/complete/failed), generated image ID, and error message
Enumerates display size hints for images placed within era narrative text: small, medium, large, or full-width
References a chronicle's cover or scene image for embedding within an era narrative, carrying the chronicle identity, image source type, and resolved image ID
Represents a request for a new scene image generated specifically for an era narrative, tracking the scene description, generation status, and resulting image ID
Union type for images that can appear within an era narrative: either a reference to an existing chronicle image or a new prompt-generated scene image
Container for all image references within an era narrative, holding the refs array along with generation timestamp and model identifier
Per-chronicle input to the thread synthesis step of era narrative generation, carrying the chronicle identity, optional era year, source weight classification, and the prep text
Lightweight era summary for world-level context in era narrative generation, containing only ID, name, and summary text
World-level context loaded at the start of era narrative generation, including focal and adjacent era summaries, previous era's thesis for continuity, resolved dynamics, and culture identity traits

The primary persisted data structure for an era narrative in IndexedDB, containing all identity fields, status, tone, arc direction, thread synthesis, content versions, cover image, inline image refs, world context, and cost metadata
Result of fuzzy anchor matching within text, returning the verbatim matched phrase, its character index position, and whether the match was exact or fuzzy
Caches the per-fact reinforcement counts for a specific simulation run, used to avoid recomputing fact coverage statistics across multiple annotation sessions
Tracks annotation quality metrics across the corpus, identifying superlative claims, overused note openings, and other voice repetition patterns to improve historian annotation diversity
Caches the corpus voice digest for a specific simulation run to avoid recomputing repetition analysis across multiple annotation sessions

Identifies a specific canon fact that needs better coverage in annotations, specifying the action (surface a weak fact or connect entities to it), evidence from coverage reports, and corpus-wide strength percentage
Enumerates the available tonal presets for historian annotations, each representing a distinct scholarly personality from resigned and world-weary to wistful and bemused

Classifies historian annotation notes into functional categories: commentary (observation), correction (factual fix), tangent (personal aside), skepticism (questioning), and temporal (anachronism/displacement)
Controls the visibility of a historian note: disabled (hidden entirely), popout (collapsed/minimized), or full (rendered inline in the Chronicler)

Represents a single historian annotation attached to source text via an anchor phrase, carrying the note text, type, display mode, weight (major/minor), acceptance status, and optional fact reinforcement links

Project-level configuration defining the historian persona: name and title, background/credentials, personality traits, mannerisms, and areas of expertise for consistent scholarly voice across annotations
Identifies the kind of content being annotated by the historian: entity (description), chronicle (narrative text), or chronology (temporal ordering)
Enumerates the lifecycle states of a historian review run: pending, generating, reviewing (notes generated, user deciding), complete, cancelled, or failed
Persisted IndexedDB record for a historian review session, tracking the run identity, status, tone, target type/ID/name, source text, generated notes, and LLM cost/prompt metadata
Structured LLM response from a historian annotation generation, containing an array of raw notes with anchor phrases, text, types, and major/minor weight classifications
Maps a chronicle to its assigned year within a historian chronology, including the LLM's reasoning for the temporal placement
Structured LLM response from a historian chronology session, containing the array of per-chronicle year assignments
Configuration for the OpenAI image generation client, specifying enabled state, API key, model name, and default size and quality settings
Parameters for a single image generation request, including the prompt text and optional size and quality overrides
